result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Dionte Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/15/2016 alternate 4 days. Payment plan fee of $15.00 to be added as well.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Hoff
Certificate of completion

Defendant Steven Dionte Davis in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid at the rate of $50/month commencing on 11/15/16 or 4 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.

Defendant Steven Dionte Davis in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse for attorney Hoff.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant to go to the business center to check on his payments for his attorney. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to complete his counseling and set the matter for plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 10:15 am.
